item.title: [HIVE-14397] Queries ran after reopening of tez session launches additional sessions
item.description:
Say we have configured hive.server2.tez.default.queues with 2 queues q1 and q2 with default expiry interval of 5 mins.

After 5 mins of non-usage the sessions corresponding to queues q1 and q2 will be expired. When new set of queries are issue after this expiry, the default sessions backed by q1 and q2 and reopened again. Now when we run more queries the reopened sessions are not used instead new session is opened.
At this point there will be 4 sessions running (2 abandoned sessions and 2 current sessions).
item.summary: Queries ran after reopening of tez session launches additional sessions

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Siddharth Seth/Sergey Shelukhin Can someone plz review this patch?

Which part of the patch fixes the problem where "when we run more queries the reopened sessions are not used instead new session is opened"?
Queue name logic makes sense to me

Sergey Shelukhin The root cause of this bug is this code
https://github.com/apache/hive/blob/master/ql/src/java/org/apache/hadoop/hive/ql/exec/tez/TezSessionPoolManager.java#L275-L287

If the queue name is set in conf then it always creates a new session when getSession is invoked.

The part that fixes this is conf.unset("tez.queue.name"). This makes sure we use the sessions from the pool when available.

The other part of the patch

conf.set(TezConfiguration.TEZ_QUEUE_NAME, sessionState.getQueueName());

is required to reopen the initial sessions when user specified queue name is not available. If we don't set this then all the reopened sessions will use "default" queue.

comments.comment:
The test wait for EVENTS_TTL * 2 = 60s and assume events are cleaned up. In the meantime, DbNotificationListener.CleanerThread is invoked every 60s. It is possible cleanup thread doesn't get a chance to run during the test wait time.

I'd like to increase frequency of CleanerThread in the test to make sure it will get a chance to run during the waiting.

item.title: [HIVE-14400] Handle concurrent insert with dynamic partition
item.description:
With multiple users concurrently issuing insert statements on the same partition has a side effect that some queries may not see a partition at the time when they're issued, but will realize the partition is actually there when it is trying to add such partition to the metastore and thus get AlreadyExistsException, because some earlier query just created it (race condition).

For example, imagine such a table is created:

create table T (name char(50)) partitioned by (ds string);

and the following two queries are launched at the same time, from different sessions:

insert into table T partition (ds) values ('Bob', 'today'); -- creates the partition 'today'
insert into table T partition (ds) values ('Joe', 'today'); -- will fail with AlreadyExistsException
item.summary: Handle concurrent insert with dynamic partition

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

item.title: [HIVE-14401] Possibility to define database specific S3 parameters
item.description:
Currently you can configure your S3 parameters (endpoint, access key, secret key) e.g. in core-site.xml. Apparently it should be possible to set these with SET command from your client as well, but at least I was not able to get it working with beeline.

Hive allows "use database" to separate data, but as far as I can tell it's currently not possible to define database specific S3 parameters.

When you use S3 as a data source, it would be good if different users working on different databases could use different S3 buckets (with different endpoints & credentials).
item.summary: Possibility to define database specific S3 parameters

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [HIVE-14403] LLAP node specific preemption will only preempt once on a node per AM
item.description:
Query hang reported by Carter Shanklin

Turns out that once an AM has preempted a task on a node for locality, it will not be able to preempt another task on the same node (specifically for local requests)

Manifests as a query hanging. It's possible for a previous query to interfere with a subsequent query since the AM is shared.
item.summary: LLAP node specific preemption will only preempt once on a node per AM

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Patch to fix this, along with additional log messages and unit tests.

The core change in the patch is the following... 

-        val = new MutableInt(1);
+        val = new MutableInt(0);

Gunther Hagleitner, Prasanth Jayachandran - please review.
Minor update to fix an import and re-introduce a break statement which was accidentally deleted (exited out of a loop early, and functionally harmless to skip it)

item.title: [HIVE-14404] Allow delimiterfordsv to use multiple-character delimiters
item.description:
HIVE-5871 allows for reading multiple character delimiters. Would like the ability to use outputformat=dsv and define multiple character delimiters. Today delimiterfordsv only uses on character even if multiple are passes.

For example:

when I use:

beeline>!set outputformat dsv
beeline>!set delimiterfordsv "-"

I get:

111201081253106275^31-Oct-2011 00:00:00^Text^201605232823^2016051968232151^201605232823_2016051968232151_00000_0_1

Would like it to be:

111201081253106275^31-Oct-2011 00:00:00Text2016052328232016051968232151-^201605232823_2016051968232151_00000_0_1
item.summary: Allow delimiterfordsv to use multiple-character delimiters

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.

comments.comment:
The Super CSV library is used to generate the output if the outputformat is dsv. Unfortunately Super CSV doesn’t support multiple characters as delimiter. They have an open issue for this:
https://github.com/super-csv/super-csv/issues/10

I can think of two possible ways to solve this issue.
1. Implement the change in Super CSV and get a new version of it. However I don’t know anything about the lifecycle of Super CSV releases, so getting a new version might take some time.
2. Implement a new OutputFormat in Hive for the dsv output format which supports the multi-character delimiters. This could use the same logic as currently if the delimiter is only one character, so only the multiple character case should be implemented.

Which one would be the preferred way to go?
My preference would be #2 as Super CSV does not look like its an Apache project. Making the change in the context of hive would contribute to supportability.

Introduced a new outputformat (dsv2) which supports multiple characters as delimiter.
For generating the dsv, csv2 and tsv2 outputformats, the Super CSV library is used. This library doesn’t support multiple characters as delimiter. Since the same logic is used for generating csv2, tsv2 and dsv outputformats, I decided not to change this logic, rather introduce a new outputformat (dsv2) which supports multiple characters as delimiter.
The new dsv2 outputformat has the same escaping logic as the dsv outputformat if the quoting is not disabled.
Extended the TestBeeLineWithArgs tests with new test steps which are using multiple characters as delimiter.

Main changes in the code:

  • Changed the SeparatedValuesOutputFormat class to be an abstract class and created two new child classes to separate the logic for single-character and multi-character delimiters:
    SingleCharSeparatedValuesOutputFormat and MultiCharSeparatedValuesOutputFormat
  • Kept the methods which are used by both children in the SeparatedValuesOutputFormat and moved the methods specific to the single-character case to the SingleCharSeparatedValuesOutputFormat class.
  • Didn’t change the logic which was in the SeparatedValuesOutputFormat, only moved some parts to the child class.
  • Implemented the value escaping and concatenation with the delimiter string in the MultiCharSeparatedValuesOutputFormat.
Review is created and linked. Please review the patch.

Patch is fixed according to the review:

  • Display an error message if multiple character delimiter is set with dsv output format. In this case it will fall back to the default dsv delimiter.
  • Introduced new constant for default dsv2 delimiter to avoid the String<->char conversions.

item.title: [HIVE-14406] ORC should be supported in mixed file format tables
item.description: Hive supports tables with partition-wise file formats and serdes (see partition_wise_fileformat*.q tests for example usage). The ORC file format/serde combination is explicitly prevented from being used in mixed format tables. This was added in HIVE-12728. To have parity with the other formats, ORC should be supported in mixed format tables.
item.summary: ORC should be supported in mixed file format tables

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [HIVE-14407] issues when redirecting CLI output
item.description:
I was running a script the other day and noticed that with tez.print.exec.summary enabled, the colorful headers are still output to console (with simple > redirect on Linux), while everything else including the rows of the same tables goes into the file. Probably needs special handling like we have for updatable vs non-updatable output for job progress.

Additionally, whereas CLI normally exits after running the script with i argument, it does not exit when redirecting.
item.summary: issues when redirecting CLI output

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: Prasanth Jayachandran Ashutosh Chauhan fyi. I dunno if anyone feels ownership over CLI... it doesn't look like it
